page.title: 20A Child's View Of Nantwich.
page.content: {The following lines of descriptive {prose were written by ten and eleven {year old children from Nantwich. "A small historical market town, Surrounded by fields and farms. Black and white buildings each unique Traffic-free streets. Sounding bells and chiming clock from- A red sandstone church towering high. Locals called Dabbers River Weaver flowing slowly by, Swans on a freshwater lake, Brine baths from a salty spring. Station with trains passing through. Entertainment for night and day, Young and old alike. Restaurants,cafes,pub's abound. Tourists talking,taking pictures and Reading local history. Town Crier shouting news of events Flowers blooming everywhere- In{Nantwich--a Cheshire masterpiece."
